content.description:
Granite Sphinx of Taharqo, 680 BCE
© The Trustees of the British Museum
The Sphinx of Taharqo likely depicts a Nubian king of the twenty-fifth dynasty.
content.question: Which of the following statements best summarizes the political significance of artifacts such as this sculpture in the twentieth century?

choices.label: They provided evidence of the Bantu-speaking ancestry of a large number of African Americans and highlighted how this maintained a connection between the continent and diaspora.
They reflected the spiritual practices of West Central Africa and demonstrated the survival of African diasporic religions including Voodoo.
They provided an example of government systems developed by African societies located in tropical rainforests and demonstrated the endurance of those government systems over time.
They helped demonstrate the complexity of Africa’s ancient societies and justified African arguments for independence from European colonizers.

content.answer: They helped demonstrate the complexity of Africa’s ancient societies and justified African arguments for independence from European colonizers.
